strIntroduction: Tanabata is a summer festival which occurs on July 7 - the only night when the two stars Vega and Altair meet on the sky. The old Chinese legend tells the story of the Weaving Princess and the Cow Herder who were lovers and turned into stars by the Sky King, separated by the Milky Way and condemned to meet only once per year. Japanese people celebrate Tanabata by throwing parties with seasonal food and drinks, as well as writing their wishes on pieces of paper ("tanzaku") which are tied to bamboo branches. If the sky on the night of July 7 is clear and you can see the stars, your wish will come true! You can join a traditional Japanese banquet for Tanabata in Tokyo. Besides meeting local people and celebrating the festival together with them, you will be able to taste seasonal dishes prepared specially for this occasion. Drinks are included too! Here is what the menu includes: - Seared beef with Chinese yam - Bamboo potage - Sushi wrapped in a bamboo leaf - Bamboo sake (Kyoto Fushimi) A minimum of 3 people are required to book this dinner. The location is near Omotesando, Tokyo.
strTitle: Celebrate Tanabata with Japanese food and drinks (July 7)

strIntroduction: In this activity, you will be able to experience traditional Japanese farm work on an authentic farm without even getting out of Tokyo! This is a rare opportunity to learn more about the local agricultural production and experience the lifestyle of farmers in Japan! The eco-production farm is located in Mitaka, which is only 25 minutes away by train from Shinjuku or Shibuya Stations. The farm has been awarded numerous prizes for the high quality of their vegetable products. The local farmer speaks English and will introduce you to the secrets of ecologic farm production. Various types of vegetables are grown here and you will be able to try harvesting seasonal products. In addition, you will be able to taste the fresh vegetables! The following is an example schedule: 12:15pm - Meet at Mitakadai Station 12:30 - 12:45pm - Greeting and Change of Clothes 12:45 - 1:15pm - Field Tour 1:15 - 2:15pm - Harvesting Experience 2:15 - 2:30pm - Break 2:30 - 3:55pm - Cook and Taste Freshly Harvested Vegetables 4:00pm - End of Activity
strTitle: Experience Harvesting and Farm Work in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is only one day workshop to be held on July 25, but it is the first of a series of Washoku (Japanese cuisine) workshops. We will introduce you to the hidden secrets of "Umami", an aesthetic culinary pleasure derived from savoring the taste of Japanese food with all 5 senses. The first workshop is called "The World of Rice". After you arrived in Japan, you might have wondered about the following phrases you've heard: Why do Japanese people say “Itadakimasu” “Gochisosama” at the end of the meal? How has “rice” been positioned in the Japanese culture over the centuries? By attending this workshop, you will be able to: 1. Understand “rice” – philosophy, history, culture and practices 2. Raise awareness of differences – varieties of rice – using your five senses 3. Improve your understanding on Japanese culture, especially the Umami philosophy 4. Gain communication skills – both Japanese and English The workshop will be held between 10:30 and 14:30 on July 25, 2015, in two languages - Japanese and English. Below is the schedule of the workshop: 1. Lecture – Rice and Japanese culture 2. Experiments – Tasting/Cooking different varieties of rice 3. Lunch – Experiencing the Philosophy of Ichijyu-Sansai (one soup and two dishes, usually rice and fish) 4. Challenge Game – Tasting some unique Japanese side dishes 5. Closing The coordinator is a member of the Institute for Food Consciousness. We look forward to seeing you at the workshop! Added some photos from July 11th Pre-Workshop with foreign students. Please see how it looks like.
strTitle: Japanese culinary pleasure "Umami" workshop, July 25

strIntroduction: Set time 11:30 Have a set time to tell how to grip than 11:30 sushi shef then have them make a sushi and sushi rolles
strTitle: Sushi chef experience

strIntroduction: This is a great night tour for lovers of night life who are staying in Osaka! We will begin by walking through the old and charming Showa era style local streets in downtown Osaka. Then I will take you to a local kushikatsu bar (deep fried skewered meet & vegetables). This is a very famous casual local food in Osaka area that goes well with beer! We will chat and have fun time in the bar! After dinner, I will take you to the top of the Tsuutenkaku Tower to show you the beautiful night view of Osaka city. Tsuutenkaku Tower is one of the landmarks of Osaka. The tour will take place between 17:00 and 20:00 (approximately 3-4 hours). The meeting spot will be Ebisucho Station on Sakaisuji subway line and Hankai Line, but let me know if you prefer to meet elsewhere. You can book an optional pick-up service. This is a private tour recommended for 1 to 5 adult guests. It is offered in Saturday, Sunday and national holidays.
strTitle: Enjoy a kushikatsu bar and night view from Tsuutenkaku tower

strIntroduction: This is a great tour to meet locals, hang out, see some hidden spots in Yokohama and create great memories from your trip to Japan! Join us on a tour to delicious restaurants in the city's local areas! Here is the example itinerary of this tour: 6:00 pm Pick you up at Sakuragicho Station (or Yokohama Station) 6:30 pm Go to a local restaurant! We have a lot of recommend restaurants which serve various types of Japanese food: - Izakaya pub - Eel - Yakiniku - Chinese food - Tempura - and many more! Please let us know in advance what your preferences are. 8:00 pm Leave the local restaurant. 8:30 pm Drop off at Sakuragicho Station (or Yokohama Station). We are 20 years old local people. We are glad to meet you and have fun with you in Yokohama!
strTitle: Have a delicious meal in Yokohama local area!

strIntroduction: Join us for this great shopping tour! This is the proposed schedule: 4:00 pm Pick you up by from Yokohama Station or Sakuragicho Station. 4:20 pm Go to the recommended shops which local people like and find fashionable clothes. (2 hours) All those shops are located in Minato Mirai area. 6:20 pm Go to the local area located near Yokohama station. The restaurants there serve delicious meals. (1.5 hours) There are some local restaurants we strongly recommend to you. You can choose what kind of restaurants you want to eat at. If you have any preferences, please ask us! We will select the restaurant that you will like. 7:50 pm Take you to Osanbashi pier where you can see the beautiful scenery of Minato Mirai area. (0.5 hours) 8:30 pm Drop you off at Yokohama Station or Sakuragicho Station.
strTitle: Find fashionable casual clothes in Yokohama City!

strIntroduction: This trip introduces Japanese "kawaii", which means the quality of cuteness in Japanese pop culture. A Japanese teen girl who knows everything about Shibuya and Harajuku and the current trends will organize this trip. The trip will first start at Shibuya and will go to the most popular shopping mall among teen girls - Shibuya 109. This mall has over 120 shops targeting teens selling variety of clothes, accessories, and other luxuries. Then, we will be heading off to Harajuku by walking through the Cat Street. This area is known for its unique atmosphere and eccentric shops. Alleys in this area are only known among teen girls who frequently visit Harajuku. Takeshita street is another famous street where cheap good quality kawaii items can be found. There are many travelers visiting this street but it is hard to distinguish the difference between each shop without having some basic knowledge. Guidebooks only introduce major shops but with the knowledge of Japanese teen expert girls who have been to this street for billion of times, there will be no problem. Purikura photos is also mandatory for Japanese girls. Thanks to Japanese great technology, purikura creates flawless skin, outrageous proportions, and humongous eyes which turn the Japanese girls' faces ideally kawaii. This trip will introduce Japanese “kawaii” pop culture from various aspects, which can be only known to Japanese teen girls who specialize in these areas. Information about the guide: Hello, my name is Rena. I am a freshman studying Japanese politics. I have lived in New York (USA) and in Düsseldorf (Germany) for eight years so my English is fluent! I have just started a YouTube channel delivering Japanese Kawaii culture to the world. I love the city Tokyo and I hope I can introduce new aspects of Tokyo from a local perspective!
strTitle: Introducing Japanese "kawaii" Pop culture in Tokyo!

strIntroduction: This is a tour to two fantastic locations in the eastern part of Hiroshima prefecture - the quaint town Onomichi and the rabbit island Okunoshima! We will meet at Hiroshima station in a morning, between 8 to 10 am. First, we will take a train and go to Onomichi town, which is about an hour away from Hiroshima. We will explore the old town for two hours and eat lunch there. After that we will head to the Okunoshima island by train and ferry. That island is about an hour away. We will stay there for two hours, playing with thousands of rabbits and walking around the island. It has a history of manufacturing poisonous gas during the war period so we will see the ruins of historical places too. Finally, we will come back to Hiroshima Station by train after about an hour and a half ride. Since it's really complicated to go to those two distant but beautiful places, I recommend you to join a tour and come with me! :)
strTitle: Visit the famous Rabbit Island and popular movie locations!

strIntroduction: Walk through the streets of Nippori on a 2-hour guided tour around the overwhelming stock of speciality fabric shops with a sewing enthusiast. We will meet at JR Nippori Station at the Northern exit next to the bookstore "Libro books". We will then head towards Nippori's main street and browse through the wide array of fabric shops. You will get a detailed explanation of what and where to buy items to satisfy your sewing needs. You will also get the opportunity to purchase anything at the shops just let me know! Shortly following we will head back towards the picturesque temple town of Yanaka passing the JR station. Finally ending at the foot of Yanaka's main street where you will get time to browse the shop-lined streets filled with souvenir shops, cafes, restaurants and Japanese style croquery shops with designs unique to Japan. Available Fridays and Saturdays
strTitle: Join a Nippori Fabric Town Walking Tour

strIntroduction: This night tour starts from dinner time. I can pick you up anywhere in the central area of Hiroshima and we'll go to Okonomiyaki restaurant together. After the dinner, I'll take you to the busy night life area. I'll show you bars/clubs or any fun places, depends on what kind of places you like. Please note that you need to pay for consumption in restaurants and bars/clubs by yourself. Dinner is about 3000 yen for one person, and usually the drink in bars/clubs is 500 yen. This is a very flexible and chill tour. I want to show you how the young people spend fun night on weekends in Hiroshima. Hope we can have great time together! :)
strTitle: Go out and explore the night life in Hiroshima!

strIntroduction: A major center of manga and anime culture before the rise of Akihabara in the late 1990s, Ikebukuro is home to attractions sure to please the female otaku fans as well as having appeal to all fans of the genre. Plan on an afternoon of fun visiting shops, from the huge Mandarake to tiny specialty stores, and mini-theme park attractions like J-World Shonen Jump, while eating Japanese street foods and fully immersing yourself in Ikebukuro's unique otaku culture. You will see many works (manga, games, magazines, figures) of the “boys love” genre, aimed mainly at a female audience, which focuses on passionate friendship and more between young men. Other points of interest include visual-kei rock famous for its costuming and gender-bending. You will learn about danso cafés, where female customers are served by female staff dressed as beautiful boys, and “2.5-dimensional musicals,” where anime characters from series such as “The Prince of Tennis” and “Naruto” are brought to life in stage productions. All otaku fans will enjoy Sanrio's shop where Hello Kitty welcomes you to the world of “kawaii” or cute culture, which can also be experienced through the merchandise at the nearby Pokemon Center. We visit J-World Shonen Jump for a glimpse of various fantasy worlds such as “Dragon Ball” and “Bleach.” Even longtime otaku fans familiar with Akihabara will find something new to enjoy in Ikebukuro. Women who love otaku especially should not miss it! The regular tours are scheduled for Fridays only. For other days please book the private tour option.
strTitle: Explore the Women's Otaku Scene in Ikebukuro

strIntroduction: Photo Style: It is your smile and emotions that make your time in Tokyo so unforgettable. I use a casual and journalistic approach to record those moments. You come as you are or dress up for the occasion. You may receive some direction, but mostly you can expect just to hear 'Have fun, you are in Tokyo! This is a special service for romantic photos of special occasions. The photos will capture your most emotional moments from your trip to Japan. Where to take photos: The destination is all up to you. But, I also recommend where to take photos and where you should go. We shoot your photos in one or two areas. My Tools: I use Nikon DSLR camera with several professional lenses. How to share images: You can download high resolution digital image files from your portrait session in a private online storage within 10-14 days. The digital files allow for photographic prints that meet the most demanding needs.
strTitle: Have a Special Photo Session themed "The Love Story"

You come as you are or dress up for the occasion. You may receive some direction, but mostly you can expect just to hear 'Have fun, you are in Tokyo! strIntroduction: Hokkaido's Furano and Biei valleys offer a spectacular rural panorama of flower fields, tranquil pastures, endless farmlands and green forests. Plenty of visitors come to the heart of Hokkaido every year to capture the beauty of the rural region. Furano and Biei's favourable location guarantees that there is a wide variety of grown and wide flowers throughout the entire green season. Here you will feel completely liberated from the stress of the city and will be able to fully enjoy the slow pace of the countryside life! This is a private tour wherein you will be able to visit some famous photo spots and take amazing photos of Hokkaido's best known valleys. Your guide will introduce you to some of the most scenic places where you'll be able to take stunning photos. You don't even need to have a professional camera - a rental camera is available! This tour is available every day between April 1 and November 10. You can decide the starting time between 9 am and until 6 pm. Note that the price includes a 3-hour tour. If you want to extend the tour, you need to pay additionally (only advance payment accepted, you can't extend on the day).
strTitle: Take a private tour around the best photo spots in Furano

strIntroduction: Tokachi Millenium Forest is a vast rural area in the Tokachi plains in Hokkaido. This natural treasure was established as an environmental conservation project and consists of several gardens designed by an award-winning British landscape architect. You can freely explore the Earth Garden with its lawns and background of mountains, the Forest Garden where you will be surrounded by the positive ions of the trees, and the Meadow Garden where you can enjoy many seasonal flowers. This vast outdoor park has also eco-friendly restaurants, shops, cheese-making workshops and many other facilities to rest and come in contact with nature at a slow pace. In this activity you will ride the futuristic vehicle Segway for the trial period of about 10 minutes. You will be able to learn how to navigate the Segway machine by moving your body back and forth, leaning to your sides and stopping the vehicle. The spacious grassland of Tokachi Millenium Forest is the ideal place to master your skills of riding a Segway! Only healthy people between the age of 16 to 69 and weighing up to 100 kg are allowed to ride the Segway. This activity is available between 10:00 and 16:30 from June 7 and October 13. The park is open every day until 17:00. The Segway riding activity may be cancelled in case of bad weather. Please use a rental car or a taxi to reach Tokachi Millenium Forest. From JR Tokachi Shimizu Station a taxi ride takes about 15-minutes and costs about 2500 JPY.
strTitle: Ride a Segway in the vast meadow of Tokachi Millenium Forest

strIntroduction: Ine town is located alongside Japan Sea, far from the crowded Kyoto downtown. We will take an express bus from Umeda (Osaka) or Kyoto station at 9 or 10 am. After dropping by Amanohashidate, the natural sandbar which has the common reputation as one of three best scenic views in Japan, we will arrive at Ine and have a nice Japanese style lunch. Sightsee around the town and enjoy the slow time, then check in and have dinner at a Funaya boat house inn. In the next morning, if you are fine, we will go to the morning fish port to see fishermen's daily work. The second day's main event is held at Mukai-shuzo sake brewery. They open up their brewery and we can have a sake tasting set with a side dish. Enjoy an elegant rich time and great conversations with locals! In the early evening we will take an express bus to Kyoto or Umeda station. The trip to Ine town will show you rural Japan and will create fantastic memories form your trip to Japan.
strTitle: Experience beautiful Kyoto's countryside; Ine

strIntroduction: MY MISSION: Due to the popularity of "selfie sticks," the idea of creating destination experience is coming to an end. People are now greedy to capture their travel experiences on camera instead of a simple sightseeing experience. My goal is to avoid this "selfie stick" or tripod phenomenon when traveling to experience the ultimate sightseeing and exploration! In this experience, I will be your personal photographer during your tour. Instead of using those "selfie sticks" or tripod that you have, I will capture your travel experiences while touring Tokyo. This means that you can relax without the worries of taking photos of yourself. This experience is perfect for couples, group of friends, families, and for everyone traveling Tokyo or nearby places in Kanagawa. I'll take all your photos including the places with your camera or my DSLR Camera and load them to my website so you can download them anytime you want. ABOUT ME: I'm a very relaxed and flexible person, I like to walk around so please don't worry if you think the tour will get me tired! :-D IMPORTANT REMINDERS: ※ Please bear in mind that I'm not a tour guide. I will only accompany you during your tour and photograph you and your experience. ※ The price option is per group
strTitle: Hire Your Personal Photographer During Your Tokyo Tour

strIntroduction: Shake Hands is a coworking space where people get together to enhance their works, studies, and hobbies as a second office and living. In the meantime, we will welcome to visitors too. In this service, you can use Shake Hands for a day. The service includes free drinks and wifi, as well as baggage storage services. [Open] 10:00AM-10:00PM [Access] (Tram car) Kamiyacho St. 3mins (Astramline-monorail) Hondori St. 3mins (Bus) Hiroshima Bus center St. 4mins [Attractions Nearby] Hiroshima Peace Memorial Park Hiroshima Castle Hiroshima Museum of Art Hiroshima Prefectural Art Museum Shukkeien Garden If you have any requests, please send messages. We will support you to have a satisfying stay in Hiroshima. Our future plan is to create a community where locals and visitors enjoy funny activities together such as going to baseball games for cheering Hiroshima Carp (the local team), watching Kagura (local traditional performing art), and making okonomiyaki (local food).
strTitle: Reservation for Coworking Space in Hiroshima

strIntroduction: 10:00-12:00 City of Peace & Tranquility Kyoto was the capital for over 1000 years from 794-1868. Take a visit to Heian Shrine, a beautiful replica of the Imperial Palace of old. Stroll the vast gardens, learning about ancient Japan as well as Shinto and Buddhism. Walk the Philosopher Path to Honen-In and take in the breathtaking mountain temple scenery. 13:00-15:00 City of Zen Learn about the influence of the warrior class in society and the rise of the humble tea ceremony as an art form in Japan. Visit a typical Zen Temple and practice seated meditation while gazing at the world famous sand gardens. Discover how “bushido” or the way of the samurai still influences modern Japanese culture today. 15:00-17:00 City of Shogun & Samurai The medieval period of Japan led to the rise of the Shogunate who held power over the land rather than the emperor. This period saw the unification of Japan under three powerful leaders, which later led to the Meiji Uprising a precursor to the modernization of Japan. Visit Nijo Castle and other sights of importance and learn of the forces that helped shaped today’s Japan. 17:00-19:00 City of Arts & Culture The rise of the merchant class and flourishing of the arts are truly evident in Kyoto. If one place can distinguish itself as the centre of it all, it’s Gion. Wander cobbled streets and discover the rich history of the era. Learn about the Geisha and Maiko as you roam the neighbourhoods where they still live today. Also, we get a chance to visit the iconic Kiyomizu Temple at the best time of day as the sun sets in the Western sky. BEST PART of this plan is you can choose what segments you want to join. Just one, two, three or all four! Book all four and get the fourth experience for half price.
strTitle: Take a Historical Trip through Kyoto

strIntroduction: Layovers and transfers in airports can be tiring, boring, and seemingly endless. Instead of aimlessly wandering and waiting during your layover or transfer time in Narita or Haneda Airport, enjoy talking to a local at a recommended restaurant or cafe inside the airport. We can enjoy Japanese food, tea, or anything you would like. Afterwards, I can show you around the airport until your boarding time.
strTitle: Spend time with a local during a layover at Narita Airport

strIntroduction: Tokyo is famous for its abundance of electronics stores, which can be overwhelming especially in another language. I will help you buy the products you want at the lowest prices at the best electronic retail stores in Tokyo (within the 23 central districts). If you tell me what you're interested in buying, I will research the lowest prices before we meet! Available most Sundays, other days by request.
strTitle: Shop at Electronics Retail Stores with a Local in Tokyo

strIntroduction: Tour details: Shinjuku Gyoen | Chidorigafuchi 3 hours From 14:00 to 17:00 Walk 2 km / 1.3 miles Group 6 people max On “Tokyo Cherry Blossom” photo tour, we visit the best spots for Hanami (flower viewing). First we meet at Shinjuku Gyoen. The park is famous for it’s numerous varieties of cherry trees, including early and late bloomers. Plus, we can use Shinjuku’s amazing skyscrapers as backdrop. We then move on to Chidorigafuchi: a moat located in the northwest of the Imperial Palace. There, local people small colorful boats and enjoy the view of weeping cherry blossom trees. A pink world unfolds for your cameras to capture. We’ll give you insiders spot recommendations and composition tips. You’ll also learn how to use your camera’s aperture to enhance your photos with artistic blur. You’ll enjoy playing around with juxtaposition of colors and shapes. It’s the ideal way to get to know your camera better for the rest of your trip.
strTitle: Go on a Tokyo photo tour - Tokyo Cherry Blossoms

strIntroduction: Here is the itinerary of the tour: 10:00~ pick up 11:30~12:30 lunch at Hama-Zushi 13:00~13:35 enjoy the cherry blossoms festival 13:40~14:15 visit the zoo at Tokiwa Park 14:30~ take you back to the station Following a pick-up at Ube Station or at Shin-Yamaguchi station, we will take you to "Hama-Zushi", one of the most popular sushi restaurants in Japan . We will be there by around 10:30. I will be with my daughter, and you can come alone or with a small group of people. Then we will go to Tokiwa Park in Ube, where the Sakura Festival is held on April 5. There will be attractive stage events held and you will see plenty of food stalls. In Tokiwa Park which is chosen as one of "Japan's best 100 cherry tree famous places", there are 3 500 cherry trees that fully bloom every April. Many visitors come here to enjoy the beautiful cherry blossoms. Then, we will go to the zoo in Tokiwa Park. It was just renewed recently. You will see many monkeys and pelicans, and everything looks better now after the renewal. Finally, I will take you back to the station where the tour will end.
strTitle: Enjoy Yamaguchi's great cherry blossom viewing and Sushi!

strIntroduction: Your tea master greets you before you enter the tea room, at the bamboo spout outside his home in an older Tokyo neighborhood. There he will demonstrate the purification ritual of washing your hands. Even before his brief introduction to the history and philosophy of Tea inside the soothingly beautiful tea room, you will have started to experience what the ceremony’s 16th century founders were trying to achieve. The teacher will serve you a delicious cup of matcha green tea in the traditional way, flawlessly performing dozens of well-practiced small steps to convey his deep spirit of hospitality. A tea master changes details of the ceremony to reflect the passing seasons; come back next month and the kettle, bowl, sweets, scroll and other elements will all be different. Then it is your turn to make a cup of tea, savoring fully the present moment while connecting to the universal spirit that is Tea. Regular tours are held on Monday and Wednesdays 10:30 - 12:00. Other days are available for private tours.
strTitle: Enjoy a Traditional Tea Ceremony And Make Your Own Tea

strIntroduction: This is a great activity to feel and experience the Japanese culture. First, we will learn how to make a Bento lunch box at my home, and afterwards we'll go to the Bonsai Village by train to enjoy the tranquil atmosphere of the neighbourhood. A Bento is a traditional kind of Japanese packed lunch commonly made for 'salarymen' and schoolchildren alike, and home-made ones often incorporate all kind of fun designs! We will take our Bentos with us in the Bonsai Village and have lunch there. The tour will end after the lunch. In the Bonsai Village, there is an attractive bonsai museum and many interesting bonsai gardens that we can see. Enjoy the Japanese culture of bonsai trees! What's included in the Bento: - Rice (Onigiri or Inarizushi or character-face rice) - Main (Fish or Chiken or Vegetables) - Seasonable vegetables - Tamagoyaki（egg) - Fruits or Sweets Example time Schedule: 10:00 Meet at Sengendai Station 10:10 Make a Bento in my home 11:45 Go to the Bonsai Village. 12:30 Take the Bento with us in the Bonsai Village and eat lunch at there. 13:00 End of tour
strTitle: Learn to make a Bento & Visit the Bonsai Village

strIntroduction: Enjoy Kyabakura through our experience program! This is an experience program at Kyabakura, a unique type of Japanese night entertainment. Cute girls will provide excellent hospitality. This Kyabakura is located in Roppongi, Tokyo. *No extra charge *Girls in attractive costume will serve you with generous hospitality. *Interpreter (English only) will help you with communication between the girls and the staff, as well as with information about how to get to the Kyabakura from your nearest station. *Additional charge would occur in following cases: - Order different drink or food - Order drink for the girls - Appoint a girl - Extend the staying time *Available days and time Monday to Saturday From 8pm to 11pm Rules at Kyabakura ~do’s and don’ts~ There are rules and manners to follow when you visit a Kyabakura. Please read them through before your first visit to Kyabakura. Dress code: There is no dress code. Jeans, T-shirts, sandals, a pair of suits are accepted; however, the girls will not be happy if your clothing is dirty or smells bad. Of course, naked is not accepted. Carry-in: It is prohibited to carry food and beverage into the Kyabakura. Souvenirs for the hostesses are accepted even if it is food or beverage. Eating or drinking the souvenir inside is not accepted though. Body touch: Not allowed. There may be a case where the girls would touch you, but you are not allowed to touch them. Conversation: There are a few topics that cannot be talked in conversation with the hostesses, such as their private lives. Some hostesses use dummy name and have another job, so asking those private questions, like real name and address, should be avoided. Also, the girls would not like too much dirty talk, so please be careful. If these rules are not followed, the staff of the Kyabakura has the right to ask you to leave the place. Let’s follow the rules and instruction to avoid any troubles. Gentleman who follow the rules and manners usually score big with the girls. *These are the basic rules and manners at Kyabakura. They may vary by location.
strTitle: Experience Kyabakura Night Entertainment in Roppongi

strIntroduction: Let’s wear a traditional "happi" coat and be a sushi chef! You will learn the origin of sushi through a Japanese picture-story show and witness a live demonstration by sushi chefs preparing the fresh fish. Sushi chefs will guide you step by step through the process of making your own rolled sushi & nigiri sushi, so there is nothing to worry about even for first timers! You will taste your own handcrafted sushi along with a special beef hot pot from the restaurant. Enjoy your original sushi lunch! As a keepsake, we will certify you with a "sushi experience certificate"!
strTitle: Take a Sushi making lesson with beef hot pot for Lunch

strIntroduction: Yamakawa Brewery, founded in 1946, is the only Awamori brewery located in Motobu, Okinawa. Awamori is an alcoholic beverage unique to Okinawa. This activity is only available for one day, so don't miss this opportunity! Date: Tuesday, March 3 Participants: Minimum of 4 people Maximum of 12 people Schedule: 4:00pm - Pick up at your hotel or Yanbaru Uminoeki in Motobu. 4:30pm - Yamakawa Awamori Brewery - You will receive a factory tour and tasting by the the President of the brewery, Yamakawa Munekatsu. You'll have the opportunity to try 4 different Awamori, including: - Sangosyou (alc.30%) - 3 years' vintage Awamori (alc.30%) - 5 years' vintage Awamori (alc.35%) - President Yamakawa's recommended Awamori that is not for sale Afterwards, you'll have the chance to visit and shop in the villages of Imadomari and Nakijin-mura. Enjoy walking along the beach, old traditional Okinawan homes, and rows of Fukugi trees. 6:30pm - Dinner Party - You will visit a local Okinawan home with the Yamakawa Brewery President Yamakawa Munekatsu. You'll enjoy a variety of Awamori and original Okinawan dishes. A sanshin guitar concert is held nearby, so you'll be able to enjoy traditional Okinawan music as you enjoy your dinner and drinks. 8:30pm - Drop off at your hotel or Yanbaru Uminoeki in Motobu.
strTitle: Tour Yamakawa Brewery and Enjoy Awamori and Okinawan Food

strIntroduction: This tour is a seasonal sightseeing taxi tour. It is offered between January 17 and February 1. Here is the suggested schedule for the tour: Pick up from your hotel (around 9:00) -> See the sakura cherry trees at Yaedake Fumoto from the car -> Enjoy the sakura at Yaedake parkt -> Go on a sake brewery tour in Yamakawa brewery. It was established in 1946 and you can try the local sake -> We will stop and visit the World Heritage Site, Nakijin Castle. Nakijin Castle is surrounded by breathtaking cherry blossoms and is great for taking pictures. -> Have lunch (cherry tree soba noodles) in an old private house with red roof tiles -> Go to Helios brewery, a Monde selection award-winning place. You can taste the local sake here too. -> See 20,000 sakura cherry trees in Nago castle park -> Take you back to your hotel (around a little past 17:00) Limited to hotels in Nago and Motobu. There is also a present - a small Awamori sake bottle for the first people to book!
strTitle: Enjoy earliest sakura cherries in Japan and Awamori cellars

strIntroduction: In a small group (maximum 5 guests) six-hour tour, get at the heart of washoku's excellence by exploring the daily culinary habits of the Japanese people. Japanese food and the culture around it has been declared a world treasure by UNESCO, and the influence of Japanese food can be felt on high cuisine around the world. But the source of washoku’s remarkable uniqueness is in the daily food culture of the Japanese people, a food culture both simple and elaborate, delicious and healthful. We meet before lunch at a major train station and take a short ride to an ordinary Japanese home. There you will witness a short cooking demonstration and enjoy an authentic washoku lunch. Your host will lead you through a casual home tea ceremony and teach you how to fold your own chopsticks holder from Japanese washi paper. Later you will visit a local supermarket, kitchenware store, alleyway market and food gift section of a department store, with time out for a popular street food snack. After all this wandering you will be ready for a light dinner in an intimate Japanese neighborhood food pub. You’ll be back in the city center by 6:20 p.m. ready for Tokyo's night life. As part of the tour, you will receive your own brand new copy of a manga-style washoku cookbook.
strTitle: Tokyo Daily Life Food Tour

strIntroduction: The purpose of this activity is to make lots of fans of Japan. I believe what makes your travel wonderful is the opportunity to have communication with locals. We are happy to provide you with a concise Japanese lesson which includes basic pronunciation as well as trendy jokes, so that you can enjoy a simple conversation with Japanese locals! My job, by the way, is related to Bizenyaki (Bizen style pottery) which is one of the oldest Japanese traditional pottery with 1000 years of a history. We will have a coffee break with a Bizenyaki mug. I am sure you will like it! <Time table> *Starting time varies* Meet at JR/Metro Asakusabashi Station (please note that it's NOT the same as Asakusa Station) and go to our office. - 5 mins by walk ↓ Start lesson - 100 mins ↓ Free talk - 15 mins ↓ Finish
strTitle: Learn useful Japanese phrases while having tea in Bizenyaki!
